member.name: T:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.ToolSizeEnum
member.summary: Represents sizes of tool inserted in ATC table

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.ToolSizeEnum.MR_Tool
member.summary: MR Right-Large Diameter Tool. It is applicable when Extended Magazine Tool Data PLC3 spec code [72,7] is ON Note: Physical pots on magazine must be designated for large tool in order to be valid and can be varied per machine spec. All tools having either one of these attributes ME, MR, or ML can share its dummy pots with each other. For example: Tool 309, 311, and 313 with ML, ME, and MR attribute, respectively can be inserted into magazine pot 309, 311, 313, respectively

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.ToolSizeEnum.ML_Tool
member.summary: ML Left-Large Diameter Tool. It is applicable when Extended Magazine Tool Data PLC3 spec code [72,7] is ON Note: Physical pots on magazine must be designated for large tool in order to be valid and can be varied per machine spec. All tools having either one of these attributes ME, MR, or ML can share its dummy pots with each other. For example: Tool 309, 311, and 313 with ML, ME, and MR attribute, respectively can be inserted into magazine pot 309, 311, 313, respectively

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.ToolSizeEnum.ME_Tool
member.summary: ME Super-Large Diameter Tool. It is applicable when Extended Magazine Tool Data PLC3 spec code [72,7] is ON Note: Physical pots on magazine must be designated for large tool in order to be valid and can be varied per machine spec. All tools having either one of these attributes ME, MR, or ML can share its dummy pots with each other. For example: Tool 309, 311, and 313 with ML, ME, and MR attribute, respectively can be inserted into magazine pot 309, 311, 313, respectively

members.member:
NCStatusEnum
Represents status indicator lamps are displayed at the top of the screen

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.ProgramStop
member.summary: This lamp is lit during a program stop (M00) or optional stop (M01) in the automatic or MDI mode. It blinks during dwell (G04).

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.Run
member.summary: This RUN lamp is lit while the machine is actually operating in the automatic or MDI mode.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.STM
member.summary: This lamp is lit while auxiliary function operations other than axis movements - such as spindle gear range change, tool change, and spindle rotation - are being executed. When an axis movement command and S, T, or M command are designated in the same block, the axis movement command is executed after the completion of the S, T, or M operation. If a spindle gear range command, spindle speed command, or tool number command is changed using the manual intervention function (called out by pressing the [MID AUTO MANUAL] key), the S.T.M. indicating lamp blinks.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.SlideHold
member.summary: This lamp goes on when the [SLIDE HOLD] button is pressed in the automatic or MDI mode. With a two-saddle specification machine, if the machine is operating in the automatic mode with the single block function turned on, the lamp also goes on when the operations in one block have been completed at one saddle and the other saddle has entered the slide hold state.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.Limit
member.summary: This lamp goes on when the X-axis or Z-axis reaches its variable limit position. With the two-saddle specification, it goes on if any of the XA-, ZA-, XB-, and ZBaxes reach their limit.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.NCStatusEnum.Alarm
member.summary: This lamp goes on when the machine malfunctions or an incorrect program is input. It also goes on in the event of a computer fault.

member.name: T:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.ToolPositionEnum
member.summary:
Represents cutting position in tool offset multi-system specification.
Note: Default tool cutting position is base A if specification of tool offset multi-system specification is invalid.
The cutting tool position could be associated with left or right spindle if applicable.

Figure.para: Different Cutting Tool positions when Left or Right spindle is specified.

member.name: T:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.ToolEdgeEnum
member.summary:
Represent the edge number for Multi-Edges Tool specification
OSP-P300S:
Multi-Edges Tool specification is NC spec code [5,3] ON
12 Edges specification is PLC spec code 2 [34, 0] ON
8 Edges specification is PLC spec code 2 [34, 1] ON
4 Edges specification is PLC spec code 2 [34, 4] ON
ENo
OSP-P300L:
Machines with Multi-Tool spec (NC Spec Code 2 [24, 7] MLTL = ON): It can only support up to 8 edges per tool.
TOOL DATA - TOOL LIFE MANAGEMENT
ENO.

members.member:
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- C Turret of first machine
- Sub/second spindle of first machine
- Required Sub spindle and 3 Turrets specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- C Turret of first machine
- Main spindle of first machine
- Required 3 Turrets specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- A Turret of second machine/L side of 2 sides machine
- Main spindle of second machine/L side of 2 sides machine
- Required parallel 2 spindles specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- B Turret of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Sub/second spindle of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Required Sub spindle and 4-axis and 2 Turrets specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- B Turret of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Main spindle of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Required 4-axis and 2 Turrets specification

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- A Turret of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Sub/second spindle of first machine/left side of 2 sides machine
- Required Sub spindle specification NC spec [4,1]

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
If applicable, the machine data will be for:
- A Turret of first machine/R side of 2 sides machine
- Main spindle of first machine/R side of 2 sides machine

member.name: T:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum
member.summary: Represents different levels of logging.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logAll
member.summary: Level 4 all logging events regardless of level. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logGet
member.summary: Level 3 Level 2 + all read functions. Setting the level to 3 or greater will force logging of ALL calls to the API to facilitate debugging of your application. This function is CPU intensive and should only be used for debugging purposes.

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logSet
member.summary: Level 2 Level 1 + all write functions to the API (default value for all class instances)

member.name: F:Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.LoggingLevelEnum.logException
member.summary: Level 1 All exceptions will be logged by the system. (not settable). It is highly not recommended to have polling routines that produce exceptions for any purposes.

members.member: CHG CHG

member.name: M:Okuma.CLDATAPI.DataAPI.CWorkpiece.CalZeroOffset(System.Int32,Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.AxisIndex7Enum,System.Double)
member.summary:
Determine the workpiece zero offset based on the calculation made on the input value and actual position at the specified offset index, and axis index for current sub system. The offset value is calculated so that the input value becomes the actual position.
Refer to Get Axis Name function in CAxis class for availability of axes.
For OSP-P300: The workpiece offset value is based on BASE ZERO COORDINATE (Reference Zero Coordinate System)
member.example:
This example shows how to call CalZeroOffset method
Dim objWorkpiece As CWorkpiece
Dim enAxisIndex As AxisIndex7Enum
Dim dblValue As Double
objWorkpiece.CalZeroOffset(enAxisIndex, dblValue)
member.param: Input value to be calculated from
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.DataUnit: Default unit is in mm. Other unit can be set by calling SetDataUnit method. Circular axis unit is in degree.

para.para: One of the following specifications must be met to be valid:

remarks.para: The following specifications for axes listed below must be met in order to function:

description.para: One of the following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
Sub spindle specification (NC spec [4,1])
LT specification (NC spec [4,0])
Auto tailstock specification (NC spec [27,3])
NC Tailstock specification NC spec [27,5]
Programmable Tailstock specification NC spec [27,0]
The following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
In case of A Turret, Multiple Machine specification NC spec [3,0]
and Slant Y-Axis specification NC spec [8,0] is effective
In case of B Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,0] is effective
In case of C Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,7] is effective

member.name: M:Okuma.CLDATAPI.DataAPI.CWorkpiece.AddZeroOffset(System.Int32,Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.AxisIndex7Enum,System.Double)
member.summary:
Sets workpiece zero offset by adding the input value to the existing data at the specified offset index, and axis index for current sub system.
Refer to Get Axis Name function in CAxis class for availability of axes.
For OSP-P300: The workpiece offset value is based on BASE ZERO COORDINATE (Reference Zero Coordinate System)
member.example:
This example shows how to call AddZeroOffset method
Dim enAxisIndex As AxisIndex7Enum
Dim dblValue As Double
Dim intOffsetIndex As Integer
objWorkpiece.AddZeroOffset(intOffsetIndex, enAxisIndex, dblValue)
member.param: Workpiece offset value to be added
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.DataUnit:
Default unit is in mm. Other unit can be set by calling SetDataUnit method. Circular axis unit is in degree.
Note:
Setting a value of 400 to a rotary axis will be the same as setting of 40 to that of.
Setting a value of -400 to a rotary axis will be the same as setting of 320 to that of.

member.name: M:Okuma.CLDATAPI.DataAPI.CWorkpiece.CalBaseZeroOffset(Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.AxisIndex4Enum,System.Double)
member.summary:
Determine the workpiece zero base offset based on the calculation made on the input value at the specified axis index for current sub system.
Refer to Get Axis Name function in CAxis class for availability of axes.
member.example:
This example shows how to call CalBaseZeroOffset method
Dim objWorkPiece As New CWorkpiece
Dim enAxisIndex As AxisIndex4Enum
Dim dblValue As Double
objWorkpiece.CalBaseZeroOffset(enAxisIndex, dblValue)
member.param: Input value to be calculated from
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.DataUnit: Default unit is in mm. Other unit can be set by calling SetDataUnit method. Circular axis unit is in degree.
member.remarks:
The following specifications for axes listed below must be met in order to function: AxisSpecification
W-Axis
One of the following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
Sub spindle specification (NC spec [4,1])
LT specification (NC spec [4,0])
Auto tailstock specification (NC spec [27,3])
NC Tailstock specification NC spec [27,5]
YI-Axis
The following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
In case of A Turret, Multiple Machine specification NC spec [3,0]
In case of A Turret, Slant Y-Axis specification NC spec [8,0] is effective
In case of B Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,0] is effective
In case of C Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,7] is effective
BA-Axis
The following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
In case of A Turret, NC spec [13,3] is active and NC spec 2 [3,7] is active
Compatible Chart of this function for different OSP controls: OSP ControlCompatible
P100IINo
P200No
P300L and newer controlsYes
P300S/TD Mode and newer controlsYes
P300S/TL Mode and newer controlsYes

member.name: M:Okuma.CLDATAPI.DataAPI.CWorkpiece.CalBAxisZeroShift(System.Double)
member.summary: Determine the B-Axis workpiece zero shift offset based on the calculation made on the input value for current sub system. The offset value is calculated so that the input value becomes the actual position.
member.example:
This example shows how to call CalBAxisZeroShift method
Try
objWorkpiece.CalBAxisZeroShift(CDbl(Me.txtBAxisZeroShiftOffsetValue.Text))
Me.txtBAxisZeroShiftOffset.Text = objWorkpiece.GetBAxisZeroShift()
Catch ae As ApplicationException
doError("CWorkpiece", ae.Message)
Catch ex As Exception
doError("CWorkpiece", ex.Message)
End Try
member.param: Input value to be calculated from
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.

member.name: M:Okuma.CLDATAPI.DataAPI.CWorkpiece.CalZeroShift(Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.AxisIndex4Enum,System.Double)
member.summary:
Determine the workpiece zero shift based on the calculation made on the input value and actual position at the specified axis index for current sub system. The offset value is calculated so that the input value becomes the actual position.
Refer to Get Axis Name function in CAxis class for availability of axes.
member.example:
This example shows how to call CalZeroShift method
Dim objWorkPiece As New CWorkpiece Dim enAxisIndex As AxisIndex4Enum Dim dblValue As Double
objWorkPiece.CalZeroShift(enAxisIndex, dblValue)
member.param: Input value to be calculated from
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.DataUnit: Default unit is in mm. Other unit can be set by calling SetDataUnit method. Circular axis unit is in degree.
member.remarks:
The following specifications for axes listed below must be met in order to function: AxisSpecification
W-Axis
One of the following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
Sub spindle specification (NC spec [4,1])
LT specification (NC spec [4,0])
Auto tailstock specification (NC spec [27,3])
NC Tailstock specification NC spec [27,5]
YI-Axis
The following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
In case of A Turret, Multiple Machine specification NC spec [3,0]
In case of A Turret, Slant Y-Axis specification NC spec [8,0] is effective
In case of B Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,0] is effective
In case of C Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,7] is effective
BA-Axis
The following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
In case of A Turret, NC spec [13,3] is active
Valid for upper A turret only with sub systems: NC-RUN, NC-RUN-1, NC-AL, NC-AR

Figure.para: OSP-P200 - ZERO SET - ZERO POINT - ZERO SHIFT
OSP-P300 - ZERO SET - ZERO POINT - ZERO SHIFT

member.name: M:Okuma.CLDATAPI.DataAPI.CWorkpiece.GetZeroShift(Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.AxisIndex4Enum)
member.summary:
Gets workpiece zero shift at the specified axis index for current sub system.
Refer to Get Axis Name function in CAxis class for availability of axes.
member.example: This example shows how to call GetZeroShift method Dim dblValue As Double Dim enAxisIndex As AxisIndex4Enum Dim enSubSystem As SubSystemEnum = SubSystemEnum.NC_AL objWorkpiece.SetSubSystem(enSubSystem) dblValue = objWorkpiece.GetZeroShift(enAxisIndex)
member.param: Axis Index. Value of parameter comes from Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.AxisIndex4Enum.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.returns: A System.Double value represents the workpiece zero shift at the specified axis index for current sub system.
member.DataUnit: Default unit is in mm. Other unit can be set by calling SetDataUnit method. Circular axis unit is in degree.
member.remarks:
The following specifications for axes listed below must be met in order to function: AxisSpecification
W-Axis
One of the following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
Sub spindle specification (NC spec [4,1])
LT specification (NC spec [4,0])
Auto tailstock specification (NC spec [27,3])
NC Tailstock specification NC spec [27,5]
YI-Axis
The following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
In case of A Turret, Multiple Machine specification NC spec [3,0]
In case of A Turret, Slant Y-Axis specification NC spec [8,0] is effective
In case of B Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,0] is effective
In case of C Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,7] is effective
BA-Axis
The following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
In case of A Turret, NC spec [13,3] is active
Valid for upper A turret only with sub systems: NC-RUN, NC-RUN-1, NC-AL, NC-AR

Figure.para: OSP-P200 - ZERO SET - ZERO POINT - ZERO SHIFT
OSP-P300 - ZERO SET - ZERO POINT - ZERO SHIFT

member.name: M:Okuma.CLDATAPI.DataAPI.CWorkpiece.GetZeroOffset(Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.AxisIndex4Enum)
member.summary:
Gets workpiece zero offset at the specified axis index for current sub system.
Refer to Get Axis Name function in CAxis class for availability of axes.
For OSP-P300: The workpiece offset value is based on BASE ZERO COORDINATE (Reference Zero Coordinate System)
member.example:
This example shows how to call GetZeroOffset method
Dim objWorkPiece As New CWorkpiece
Dim enAxisIndex As AxisIndex4Enum
Dim dblValue As Double
dblValue= objWorkpiece.GetZeroOffset(enAxisIndex)
member.param: Axis Index. Value of parameter comes from Okuma.CLDATAPI.Enumerations.AxisIndex4Enum.
member.exception: Thrown when function fails to perform the operation at current NC condition.
Thrown when operation/input parameters are not supported for the current system.
member.returns: A System.Double value represents the workpiece zero offset at the specified axis index for current sub system.
member.DataUnit: Default unit is in mm. Other unit can be set by calling SetDataUnit method. Circular axis unit is in degree.
member.remarks:
The following specifications for axes listed below must be met in order to function: AxisSpecification
W-Axis
One of the following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
Sub spindle specification (NC spec [4,1])
LT specification (NC spec [4,0])
Auto tailstock specification (NC spec [27,3])
NC Tailstock specification NC spec [27,5]
Programmable Tailstock specification NC spec [27,0]
YI-Axis
The following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
In case of A Turret, Multiple Machine specification NC spec [3,0]
In case of A Turret, Slant Y-Axis specification NC spec [8,0] is effective
In case of B Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,0] is effective
In case of C Turret, NC spec code 2 [21,7] is effective
BA-Axis
The following specifications must be met in order to be valid axis:
In case of A Turret, NC spec [13,3] is active
Valid for upper A turret only with sub systems: NC-RUN, NC-RUN-1, NC-AL, NC-AR

Figure.para: OSP-P200 - ZERO SET - ZERO POINT - ZERO OFFSET
OSP-P300 - ZERO SET - ZERO POINT - ZERO OFFSET

member.name: M:Okuma.CLDATAPI.DataAPI.CBase.IsLTMIMSpecOn

summary.para: Check following spec. code:
NC Spec Code 2 [3,6] TMIM for P300S or newer controls
NC Spec Code 2 [27,2] LTIM for P300L or newer controls

member.returns: A System.Boolean value. It returns false if the Spec Code is off. Otherwise, it returns TRUE.

remarks.para: All tool-related functions designed specifically for P300S or newer controls cannot be supported and it is automatically in TL mode when IsLTMIMSpecOn function returns FALSE.
All tool-related functions designed specifically for P300L or newer controls cannot be supported when IsLTMIMSpecOn function returns FALSE.
